data.enText: mentioning sb/sth

data.chText: 说到（或写到）的事；提到；谈及；涉及
data.enText: a thing you say or write that mentions sb/sth else; the act of mentioning sb/sth

data.chText: 这本书谈到许多在印度怎样长大成人的事。
data.enText: The book is full of references to growing up in India.

data.chText: 她没有提到她的病，只说了她未来的计划。
data.enText: She made no reference to her illness but only to her future plans.

data.chText: 总统对战争的结束一语带过
data.enText: the President's passing reference to (= brief mention of) the end of the war
looking for information
the act of looking at sth for information

data.chText: 把电话号码表放在电话旁边，方便查找。
data.enText: Keep the list of numbers near the phone for easy reference.

data.chText: 我记下了这家酒店的名字，以后也许用得着。
data.enText: I wrote down the name of the hotel for future reference (= because it might be useful in the future) .

data.chText: 这家图书馆藏有许多常用的参考书。
data.enText: The library contains many popular works of reference (= reference books) .
asking for advice
the act of asking sb for help or advice

data.chText: 急救护士不必征求医生的意见就可处理轻伤。
data.enText: The emergency nurse can treat minor injuries without reference to a doctor.
number/word/symbol

data.chText: （为方便查询所用的）标记，标识，编号
data.enText: a number, word or symbol that shows where sth is on a map, or where you can find a piece of information
The map reference is Y4.
Please quote your reference number when making an enquiry.
for new job
a letter written by sb who knows you, giving information about your character and abilities, especially to a new employer

data.chText: 我们在面试之后收推荐信。
data.enText: We will take up references after the interview.
a person who agrees to write a reference for you, for example when you are applying for a job

data.chText: 我的前任上司将做我的推荐人。
data.enText: My previous boss will act as a reference for me.
in book
a note in a book that tells you where a particular piece of information comes from

data.chText: 每一章的后面都有一组参考书目。
data.enText: There is a list of references at the end of each chapter.
in/with reference to
used to say what you are talking or writing about
With reference to your letter of July 22…

data.chText: 查阅；参考；给（书等）附参考资料
data.enText: to refer to sth; to provide a book, etc. with references

data.chText: 每一章都附有参考书目，引用文献近至2004年。
data.enText: Each chapter is referenced, citing literature up to 2004.

simple_means.memory_skill: refer 提到；指点 + ence 状态，行为 → 参考；引证

ex.zh: 明确的提及；清楚的引文
明确的提及；确切的引文

data.enText: in/with reference to
used to say what you are talking or writing about
With reference to your letter of July 22…

tr: the act of referring or consulting
example: reference to an encyclopedia produced the answer

tr: the most direct or specific meaning of a word or expression
the class of objects that an expression refers to
example: the extension of `satellite of Mars' is the set containing only Demos and Phobos

tr: the relation between a word or phrase and the object or idea it refers to
example: he argued that reference is a consequence of conditioned reflexes

tr: (computer science) the code that identifies where a piece of information is stored
a book to which you can refer for authoritative facts
example: he contributed articles to the basic reference work on that topic

tr: a formal recommendation by a former employer to a potential future employer describing the person's qualifications and dependability
example: requests for character references are all too often answered evasively

tr: a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage
example: the student's essay failed to list several important citations
the acknowledgments are usually printed at the front of a book
the article includes mention of similar clinical cases

tr: a remark that calls attention to something or someone
example: she made frequent mention of her promotion
there was no mention of it
the speaker made several references to his wife

tr: an indicator that orients you generally
example: it is used as a reference for comparing the heating and the electrical energy involved

tr: a publication (or a passage from a publication) that is referred to
example: he carried an armful of references back to his desk
he spent hours looking for the source of that quotation

value.def: Reference to someone or something is the act of talking about them or mentioning them. A reference is a particular example of this.

example.ex: He made no reference to any agreement...
The crowd chanted 'No Poll Tax', a reference to the government's new local taxation system...
example.tran: 人群高呼“不要人头税”，指的是政府新确立的地方税收制度。

example.ex: He summed up his philosophy, with reference to Calvin.
example.tran: 他总结了自己的哲学，还提及了加尔文。

value.def: Reference is the act of consulting someone or something in order to get information or advice.

example.ex: This might be done without reference to Parliament...
example.tran: 这件事情也许可以绕过国会直接进行。

example.ex: Please keep this sheet in a safe place for reference.
example.tran: 请把这张纸放在稳妥之处以备查阅。

value.def: Reference books are ones that you look at when you need specific information or facts about a subject.

example.ex: There are several reference books which have been compiled to help you make your choice.
example.tran: 有几本参考书专门帮你作出选择。

value.def: A reference is a word, phrase, or idea which comes from something such as a book, poem, or play and which you use when making a point about something.
A reference is something such as a number or a name that tells you where you can obtain the information you want.

example.ex: Make a note of the reference number shown on the form.
example.tran: 把表格上的编码记下来。

value.def: A reference is a letter that is written by someone who knows you and which describes your character and abilities. When you apply for a job, an employer might ask for references .

example.ex: The firm offered to give her a reference.
example.tran: 公司主动给她开具介绍信。

value.def: A reference is a person who gives you a reference, for example when you are applying for a job.
value.tran: （求职等时的）推荐人，介绍人，证明人

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 referee

value.def: If you reference a particular book or writer, you make a precise reference to them in what you are saying or writing.

example.ex: It specifically referenced Hermann Noordung's classic 1928 book on this subject.
example.tran: 在这一问题上它特别参照了赫尔曼·诺丁1928年的经典之作。

value.tran: 引用，参照（某书或某作者）

value.def: If you keep information for future reference, you keep it because it might be useful in the future.

example.ex: Read these notes carefully and keep them for future reference.
example.tran: 仔细阅读这些注释并将其保留下来以备将来之用。

value.def: You use with reference to or in reference to in order to indicate what something relates to.

example.ex: I am writing with reference to your article on salaries for scientists...
example.tran: 我写此信是为了回应你那篇探讨科学家薪水的文章。

example.ex: I'm calling in reference to your series on prejudice.
example.tran: 我打电话是要谈谈你写的有关“偏见”的系列文章。

xrsa.xrsa_see: cross-reference;frame of reference;point of reference;terms of reference

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to bring, to carry 带来, 拿来
rootsaffixes.title: fer

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 共同 + fer 带来，拿来 → 共同拿出〔观点〕→ 协商
con 共同 + fer 带来，拿来 + ence 表行为 → 商量；会议
con 加强 + fer 带来，拿来 + ment 行为 → 带给 → 给予
de 向下 + fer 带来，拿来 → 往后带 → 延期
dif 分开 + fer 带来，拿来 → 分开带 → 不同
fer 带来，拿来 + ry 表场地 → 带人〔过河〕的地方 → 渡口
fert〔= fer〕带来，拿来 + ile 物体 → 能带来〔粮食的土地〕→ 肥沃的
in 进入 + fer 带来，拿来 → 带进〔意义〕→ 推理
in 进入 + fer 带来，拿来 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 + ial …的 → 推理的
odori 气味 + fer 带来，拿来 + ous …的 → 有气味的
of 加强 + fer 带来，拿来 → 提供，提出
pre 预先 + fer 带来，拿来 → 更喜欢
pro 向前 + ffer〔= fer〕带来，拿来 → 提供
re 一再 + fer 带来，拿来 → 提到；指点
refer 提到；指点 + ee 表人 →〔双方〕都提到的人 → 裁判
refer 提到；指点 + ence 性质，状态，行为 → 参考；引证
suf 下 + fer 带来，拿来 → 带到下面〔地狱〕→ 受苦
trans 转移 + fer 带来，拿来 → 转送；转移
